TITLE: Troubleshooting Workday Expense Report Timeouts
CONTENT:
# Troubleshooting Workday Expense Report Timeouts

If you're experiencing timeouts or slow performance when submitting expense reports in Workday, follow these troubleshooting steps:

## Common Causes
- Large number of attachments (more than 10 receipts)
- High-resolution images that exceed recommended file sizes
- Peak usage times (Monday mornings, month-end deadlines)
- Browser cache issues

## Step-by-Step Resolution

### 1. Reduce Attachment Size
- Compress images before uploading
- Each receipt should be under 2MB
- Use your phone's document scanner feature for better compression
- Convert HEIC images to JPEG format

### 2. Batch Your Submissions
If you have more than 10 receipts:
- Split them across multiple expense reports
- Submit 5-7 receipts per report
- Wait for confirmation before starting the next batch

### 3. Avoid Peak Hours
- Monday mornings (8-10 AM EST) see highest traffic
- Month-end deadlines (13th-15th of each month) have 40% higher volume
- Best times to submit: Before 8 AM, after 2 PM, or Tuesday-Thursday

### 4. Clear Browser Cache
- Chrome: Settings > Privacy > Clear browsing data
- Edge: Settings > Privacy > Clear browsing data
- Select 'Cached images and files'

### 5. Check System Status
Visit the IT Status page (ServiceNow > IT Status Dashboard) to check for known issues.

## When to Contact Support
If the problem persists after trying these steps:
- Open a support ticket: Category 'Software' > Subcategory 'Workday' > Issue 'Expense Reports'
- Include: Number of receipts, file sizes, error message screenshot
- Priority: P2 for month-end deadline, P3 for routine submissions

## Related Articles
- KB-2024-003: iPhone Receipt Photo Best Practices
- KB-2024-015: Understanding Expense Report Approval Workflow
KEYWORDS: expense timeout slow workday receipt upload attachment error performance

TITLE: VPN Connection Troubleshooting Guide
CONTENT:
# VPN Connection Troubleshooting Guide

This guide helps you resolve common VPN connection issues when working remotely.

## Before You Start
Ensure you have:
- Active network connection (WiFi or Ethernet)
- Latest VPN client installed
- Valid corporate credentials

## Common Error Messages and Solutions

### Error: Certificate Validation Failed
**Cause:** Expired or corrupted certificate cache

**Solution:**
1. Open VPN Client Settings
2. Go to Connections > Advanced
3. Click 'Clear Credential Cache'
4. Restart the VPN client
5. Reconnect and re-authenticate with your credentials

### Error: Connection Refused
**Cause:** Firewall blocking VPN ports

**Solution:**
1. If on public WiFi, try a different network
2. If on home network, ensure ports 443 and 4500 are open
3. Try the alternate VPN gateway: vpn2.internal.capitalone.com

### Error: Authentication Failed
**Cause:** Password expired or account locked

**Solution:**
1. Check if you can log into Okta directly
2. If locked, contact IT Support for account unlock
3. If password expired, reset via password.capitalone.com

### Error: Connection Timeout
**Cause:** Network instability or VPN server load

**Solution:**
1. Check your internet speed (minimum 10 Mbps recommended)
2. Try connecting to a different VPN gateway
3. Restart your router if on home WiFi

## VPN Gateway Locations
- Primary: vpn.internal.capitalone.com
- Backup: vpn2.internal.capitalone.com
- Mobile: vpn-mobile.internal.capitalone.com

## Performance Tips
- Close bandwidth-heavy applications before connecting
- Use wired connection when possible
- Position WiFi router for optimal signal

## When to Contact Support
If none of the above solutions work:
- Support ticket: Category 'Network' > Subcategory 'VPN'
- Include: Error message, time of attempt, your location
- For complete inability to work: Priority P1
KEYWORDS: vpn connection remote work timeout certificate authentication network

TITLE: iPhone Receipt Photo Best Practices for Expense Reports
CONTENT:
# iPhone Receipt Photo Best Practices for Expense Reports

Follow these guidelines to ensure your iPhone receipt photos upload successfully to Concur and Workday.

## The HEIC Issue
By default, iPhones capture photos in HEIC format, which some expense systems have trouble processing. Here's how to fix it:

### Option 1: Change iPhone Camera Settings (Recommended)
1. Open Settings > Camera > Formats
2. Select 'Most Compatible' instead of 'High Efficiency'
3. This captures photos as JPEG which is universally supported

### Option 2: Use the Notes App Document Scanner
The Notes app has a built-in scanner that:
- Automatically enhances contrast (great for faded receipts!)
- Saves as PDF or JPEG
- Crops to receipt edges automatically

**How to use:**
1. Open Notes app > Create new note
2. Tap camera icon > Scan Documents
3. Position receipt and let it auto-capture
4. Tap Save > Share > Save to Photos

### Option 3: Convert Existing HEIC Photos
If you already have HEIC photos:
1. Email the photo to yourself
2. iPhone automatically converts to JPEG when emailing
3. Save the JPEG from email to upload

## Photo Quality Tips
- **Lighting:** Photograph receipts in good lighting, avoid shadows
- **Angle:** Capture straight-on, not at an angle
- **Focus:** Tap the receipt to focus before capturing
- **Size:** Keep photos under 2MB for fastest upload

## Faded Receipt Solutions
For thermal paper receipts that fade quickly:
1. Scan immediately after receiving
2. Use Notes app scanner - it enhances contrast
3. If already faded, increase exposure in Photos app before uploading

## File Size Guidelines
- Target: Under 2MB per image
- Maximum: 10MB (but may cause timeouts)
- Batch submission limit: 5-7 images recommended

## Related Articles
- KB-2024-001: Troubleshooting Workday Expense Report Timeouts
- KB-2024-022: Concur Mobile App Quick Start Guide
KEYWORDS: iphone heic receipt photo camera expense upload image convert jpeg

TITLE: Microsoft Teams Performance Optimization
CONTENT:
# Microsoft Teams Performance Optimization

Optimize your Teams experience for smooth video calls and screen sharing.

## System Requirements
**Minimum:**
- 4GB RAM
- Dual-core processor
- 3 Mbps internet

**Recommended for Large Meetings:**
- 16GB RAM
- Quad-core processor
- 10+ Mbps internet

**Your Laptop:** Check specs in Settings > System > About

## Before Important Meetings

### Close Unnecessary Applications
Teams with video uses significant resources. Before large meetings:
1. Close Chrome tabs (each tab uses memory)
2. Quit Slack if not needed
3. Close large Excel files
4. Exit any video streaming

### Check Your Setup
1. Test audio/video: Teams > Settings > Devices > Make a test call
2. Ensure good lighting for video
3. Use headphones to prevent echo
4. Connect to power (performance may be throttled on battery)

## During Screen Sharing

### Optimize for Performance
1. Share specific window instead of entire screen
2. Close confidential apps before sharing
3. Use 'Include system audio' only when needed
4. Disable 'Include video' if not necessary

### For Large Meetings (50+ Participants)
1. Consider disabling incoming video: '...' > Turn off incoming video
2. Use 'Together Mode' or 'Gallery' instead of 'Large Gallery'
3. Presenters should use wired internet connection

## Troubleshooting Crashes

### Teams Crashes During Video/Screen Share
Common cause: Insufficient RAM or GPU driver issues

**Solutions:**
1. Restart Teams: Right-click system tray icon > Quit > Reopen
2. Clear Teams cache: %appdata%\\Microsoft\\Teams\\Cache (delete contents)
3. Update display drivers: Device Manager > Display adapters > Update driver
4. Disable GPU acceleration: Settings > General > Disable GPU hardware acceleration

### Laptop Overheating
**Solutions:**
1. Use a laptop stand for better airflow
2. Reduce video quality: Settings > General > Low bandwidth mode
3. Use external webcam (less CPU than built-in)
4. Clean laptop vents with compressed air

## Hardware Refresh
If Teams regularly underperforms:
- Laptops older than 4 years may need refresh
- Request upgrade via IT Procurement portal
- Include performance issues in justification

## Related Articles
- KB-2024-010: Scheduling and Managing Large Meetings
- KB-2024-011: Teams Screen Sharing Best Practices
KEYWORDS: teams video call performance slow crash screen share meeting memory ram

TITLE: MFA and Authentication Troubleshooting
CONTENT:
# MFA and Authentication Troubleshooting

Resolve common Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and login issues.

## Understanding MFA Options
You have three MFA methods available:
1. **Okta Verify Push** - Notification to your phone (fastest)
2. **SMS Code** - Text message with 6-digit code
3. **TOTP Code** - Time-based code from Okta Verify app (works offline)

## Common Issues and Solutions

### Missed Push Notification
**Symptom:** Login timed out because you didn't receive or respond to push

**Solutions:**
1. Check phone isn't on silent/Do Not Disturb
2. Check Okta Verify app notifications are enabled
3. Try again - push notifications sometimes delay

**Prevent Future Issues:**
- Set up backup SMS or TOTP in Okta settings

### Phone Lost or Replaced
**Symptom:** Can't receive MFA because you have a new phone

**Solution:**
1. Visit helpdesk.capitalone.com from any device
2. Click 'MFA Recovery'
3. Complete identity verification (security questions + manager approval)
4. Temporary access code provided within 2 hours
5. Re-enroll MFA on new device

### Account Locked After Failed Attempts
**Symptom:** 'Account locked' message after multiple wrong passwords

**Solution:**
1. Wait 15 minutes for automatic unlock, OR
2. Contact IT Support for immediate unlock
3. Have your manager confirm your identity
4. Reset password at password.capitalone.com

### MFA Not Working Abroad
**Symptom:** No push notifications or SMS while traveling

**Solution:**
1. Use TOTP codes (work offline)
2. Open Okta Verify > Click account > Get code
3. Enter 6-digit code within 30 seconds

**Before Travel:**
- Notify IT Support of travel dates
- Confirm TOTP is set up and working

## Setting Up Backup Authentication

### Add Backup Phone Number
1. Log into okta.capitalone.com
2. Go to Settings > Edit Profile
3. Add secondary phone number for SMS backup

### Enable TOTP Codes
1. Open Okta Verify app
2. Tap your Capital One account
3. Codes display automatically - refresh every 30 seconds

## Related Articles
- KB-2024-020: Password Reset and Requirements
- KB-2024-021: Okta Verify Setup Guide
KEYWORDS: mfa authentication login password locked push notification okta verify sms

TITLE: Outlook Mailbox Management and Performance
CONTENT:
# Outlook Mailbox Management and Performance

Keep your Outlook running smoothly by managing mailbox size and optimizing performance.

## Mailbox Size Guidelines
- **Recommended maximum:** 25GB
- **Warning threshold:** 35GB (you'll see performance impact)
- **Hard limit:** 50GB (new mail may be blocked)

**Check your size:** File > Info > Mailbox Settings > Manage Mailbox Size

## Reducing Mailbox Size

### Enable Auto-Archive (Recommended)
Auto-archive moves old emails to local storage, keeping mailbox lean:
1. File > Options > Advanced > AutoArchive Settings
2. Enable 'Run AutoArchive every 14 days'
3. Set 'Clean out items older than 6 months'
4. Choose archive location

### Delete Large Attachments
Attachments consume the most space:
1. Create search folder: View > Folder Pane > New Search Folder > Large Mail
2. Review and delete unnecessary large emails
3. For needed attachments, save to OneDrive and delete email

### Empty Deleted Items
Deleted emails still count toward quota:
1. Right-click Deleted Items folder
2. Select 'Empty Folder'
3. Enable auto-empty: File > Options > Advanced > 'Empty Deleted Items when exiting'

## Performance Optimization

### Search Running Slow
**Cause:** Large mailbox with outdated index

**Solution:**
1. File > Options > Search > Indexing Options
2. Click 'Modify' > Ensure Outlook is checked
3. Click 'Advanced' > 'Rebuild' to refresh index
4. Allow 2-3 hours for rebuild to complete

### Outlook Crashes or Freezes
**Solutions:**
1. Start in Safe Mode: Hold Ctrl while clicking Outlook
2. Disable add-ins: File > Options > Add-ins > Manage COM Add-ins > Uncheck non-essential
3. Repair Office: Control Panel > Programs > Microsoft 365 > Repair

### Calendar Sync Issues
If calendar shows duplicates or sync errors:
1. Close Outlook completely
2. Clear offline cache: Navigate to %localappdata%\\Microsoft\\Outlook
3. Delete .ost file (will rebuild on next launch)
4. Reopen Outlook and wait for sync

## Related Articles
- KB-2024-007: Outlook Mobile App Setup
- KB-2024-008: Calendar Sharing Best Practices
KEYWORDS: outlook slow performance mailbox size archive search crash calendar sync

TITLE: ServiceNow Ticket Submission Best Practices
CONTENT:
# ServiceNow Ticket Submission Best Practices

Get faster resolution by submitting well-structured support tickets.

## Choosing the Right Category
Proper categorization routes your ticket to the right team:

| Issue Type | Category | Subcategory |
|------------|----------|-------------|
| Can't access an application | Access | [Application Name] |
| Application error or bug | Software | [Application Name] |
| Slow performance | Software | Performance |
| Need new software | Request | Software Install |
| Hardware issue | Hardware | [Laptop/Monitor/etc.] |
| Network/WiFi issue | Network | Connectivity |
| VPN issue | Network | VPN |

## Priority Guidelines
- **P1 - Critical:** Complete work stoppage for multiple people
- **P2 - High:** Major impact, workaround difficult or unavailable
- **P3 - Medium:** Moderate impact, workaround available
- **P4 - Low:** Minor issue, minimal business impact

⚠️ Over-prioritization may result in reclassification and delays

## Writing Effective Descriptions

### Include These Elements:
1. **What happened:** Exact error message or behavior
2. **When:** Date and time of occurrence
3. **Frequency:** First time, intermittent, or constant
4. **Steps to reproduce:** What were you doing when it happened
5. **Impact:** How this affects your work
6. **Attempted solutions:** What you've already tried

### Example of a Good Description:
'Starting at 9 AM today (1/15), I've been unable to submit expense reports in Workday. When I click Submit, it spins for about 5 minutes then shows 'Timeout Error'. I have 12 receipts attached. I've tried clearing my browser cache and reducing to 5 receipts but still fails. Month-end deadline is today so this is urgent.'

### Example of a Poor Description:
'Workday broken.'

## Attaching Evidence
Always include:
- Screenshots of error messages
- Relevant log files if available
- Steps to reproduce in writing

## Tracking Your Ticket
1. Note your ticket number (TKT-XXXX-XXXXX)
2. Check status via ServiceNow > My Tickets
3. Respond promptly to agent questions
4. Mark as resolved when fixed

## Related Articles
- KB-2024-012: How to Take Effective Screenshots
- KB-2024-013: Escalation Procedures
KEYWORDS: ticket support servicenow help desk priority category description issue report

TITLE: SharePoint and OneDrive Large File Uploads
CONTENT:
# SharePoint and OneDrive Large File Uploads

Best practices for uploading large files without timeouts.

## File Size Limits
- **Browser upload limit:** 100MB recommended during peak hours
- **OneDrive sync limit:** 250GB per file
- **Maximum file size:** 250GB

## Method Comparison

| Method | Best For | Max Size | Speed |
|--------|----------|----------|-------|
| Browser drag & drop | Small files (<50MB) | 100MB | Slow |
| OneDrive sync | Large files, folders | 250GB | Fast |
| Teams upload | Team documents | 250GB | Medium |

## Using OneDrive Sync (Recommended for Large Files)

### Setup
1. Open SharePoint library in browser
2. Click 'Sync' button in toolbar
3. OneDrive opens and creates synced folder on your PC
4. Green checkmark = synced

### Uploading
1. Simply copy/paste or drag files into the synced folder
2. Files upload in background
3. Blue arrows = uploading, Green check = complete

## Troubleshooting Upload Failures

### Timeout Errors in Browser
**Cause:** Network interruption or peak usage

**Solutions:**
1. Switch to OneDrive sync instead
2. Try off-peak hours (before 8 AM or after 6 PM)
3. For video files, use Microsoft Stream instead

### Sync Stuck or Slow
**Solutions:**
1. Right-click OneDrive icon in system tray
2. Click 'Pause syncing' for 2 hours, then 'Resume'
3. If persistent, Help & Settings > Quit OneDrive, then restart

### File Names Not Syncing
Some characters aren't supported:
- Avoid: \ * : < > ? / \\ |

ARTICLE_ID: 1. Microsoft Stream is optimized for video

TITLE: sharepoint onedrive upload large file sync timeout video stream document
Password Reset and Security Best Practices
CONTENT:
# Password Reset and Security Best Practices

Everything you need to know about passwords at Capital One.

## Password Requirements
Your password must:
- Be at least 12 characters
- Include uppercase and lowercase letters
- Include at least one number
- Include at least one special character (!@#$%^&*)
- Not be any of your last 12 passwords
- Not contain your name or username

## Resetting Your Password

### If You Know Your Current Password
1. Go to password.capitalone.com
2. Click 'Change Password'
3. Enter current password, then new password twice
4. Click Submit

### If You Forgot Your Password
1. Go to password.capitalone.com
2. Click 'Forgot Password'
3. Enter your username/email
4. Complete identity verification (security questions)
5. Check email for reset link

### If Account Is Locked
After 5 failed attempts:
1. Wait 15 minutes for automatic unlock, OR
2. Call IT Support at x4HELP (x44357)
3. Have your employee ID ready

## Password Expiration
- Passwords expire every 90 days
- You'll receive warnings at 14, 7, and 3 days before expiration
- Expired passwords must be reset before you can log in

## Password Manager
We recommend using the company-approved password manager:
1. Request installation via IT Request Portal
2. It securely stores unique passwords for each app
3. Auto-fills login forms
4. Generates strong passwords

## Security Tips
- Never share your password with anyone
- Never write passwords down
- Use different passwords for work and personal accounts
- Report suspicious login attempts to Security team

## Related Articles
- KB-2024-005: MFA and Authentication Troubleshooting
- KB-2024-021: Okta Verify Setup Guide
KEYWORDS: password reset forgot locked expired security change requirements account

TITLE: Power BI Dashboard Troubleshooting
CONTENT:
# Power BI Dashboard Troubleshooting

Resolve common issues with Power BI dashboards and reports.

## Common Issues

### Dashboard Shows Stale Data
**Symptom:** Report shows 'Last refreshed: [old date]'

**Causes:**
- Scheduled refresh failed
- Data source connection issue
- Insufficient permissions

**Solutions:**
1. Check if it's a known outage: IT Status Dashboard
2. Contact the dashboard owner (listed in report description)
3. For urgent business needs, IT can trigger manual refresh

### Permission Denied Error
**Symptom:** 'You don't have permission to view this report'

**Solutions:**
1. Request access from dashboard owner
2. Check if you're in the right security group
3. Submit access request via ServiceNow

### Dashboard Loading Slowly
**Causes:**
- Large dataset
- Complex visualizations
- Network issues

**Solutions:**
1. Clear browser cache
2. Try a different browser (Edge recommended)
3. Check internet speed
4. Ask dashboard owner about optimization

### Data Looks Wrong
**Before reporting a bug:**
1. Verify date range filters are correct
2. Check if filters are applied (look for filter icons)
3. Compare with source data if possible
4. Note specific discrepancy for report

## Requesting Dashboard Changes
1. Document the change needed
2. Submit via ServiceNow > Request > 'Analytics/BI Request'
3. Include: Dashboard name, URL, specific change, business justification

## Related Articles
- KB-2024-016: Accessing Power BI from Home
- KB-2024-017: Power BI Mobile App Setup
KEYWORDS: power bi dashboard report refresh data stale permission slow analytics
